abstract_summ: We surveyed over 3,000 doctoral psychologists about the impact of the COVID-19 health crisis on their clinical practices.(PsycInfo Database Record (c) 2020 APA, all rights reserved).The COVID-19 crisis has transformed the lives and practices of psychologists and has highlighted the need for time-efficient self-care.The work of all nurses globally reinforces their pivotal role in healthcare during this time of crisis precipitated by the COVID-19 pandemic - something I never thought we would see to this scale in our lifetime.Religious leaders are at risk of psychological trauma and moral injury during the COVID-19 pandemic.The COVID-19 crisis can be defined as a collective trauma, which contributes to an upheaval of community connection and functioning.
title_summ: The haka: Wonderful bonding, sending a challenge in a global crisis, or merely cultural appropriation?Collective trauma and community support: Lessons from Detroit.Resilience or Resistance: A personal response to COVID-19.Psychological trauma and moral injury in religious leaders during COVID-19.Psychologist Self-Care During the Pandemic:A Rapid Response SurveyReflections: a Daughter’s Experience of Parental Cancer and the Beginnings of Un Abrazo Para La Familia™Now More Than EverPsychological Practice and the COVID-19 Crisis:
title_abstract_phrases: We surveyed over 3,000 doctoral psychologists about the impact of the COVID-19 health crisis on their clinical practices.(PsycInfo Database Record (c) 2020 APA, all rights reserved).Psychologist Self-Care During the Pandemic: Now More Than EverThe COVID-19 crisis has transformed the lives and practices of psychologists and has highlighted the need for time-efficient self-care.Psychological trauma and moral injury in religious leaders during COVID-19.Religious leaders are at risk of psychological trauma and moral injury during the COVID-19 pandemic.The COVID-19 crisis can be defined as a collective trauma, which contributes to an upheaval of community connection and functioning.Psychological Practice and the COVID-19 Crisis: A Rapid Response SurveyPsychological practice has changed dramatically over the past 125 years.
